titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: We left Paddington at 1.40 p.m. and arrived in Hereford at 5.59 p.m. We were very nearly destroyed on the way from the station to the Deanery, but the nerve of the young lady–motorist averted a catastrophe. We were kindly received by the Dean & Lady Butler. Sir Richard Butler was home on leave from Italy.
